required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Vitamin C Injection on Fatigue in Workers After Work
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of High Dose Vitamin C Parenteral Supplement on Amelioration of Fatigue in Company Workers After Work: A Double-Blind, Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Fatigue is one of the most frequently observed symptoms for company workers, and oxidative stress is regarded as one of its cause. Vitamin C is a well-known antioxidant, and the investigators seek for evidence of the efficacy of high dose vitamin C parenteral supplement on fatigue symptoms of company workers after work.

detailed_description.textblock: Previous studies dealing with vitamin C were focusing on terminal cancer patients or those with chronic fatigue syndrome. Since used drug dosage and the ways of administering vitamin C were not identical, the results were not consistent throughout those studies. This study is aimed to evaluate the efficacy of high dose vitamin C with parenteral supplement on relieving fatigue for apparently healthy volunteers.

primary_outcome.measure: Degree of fatigue at the point of time with visual analogue scale from 0 to 10
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before intravenous vitamin C injection and right after completing injections, and one day later

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before intravenous vitamin C injections, right after completing injections, and one day later
Before intravenous vitamin C injections and right after completing injections

arm_group.description: Intravenous injections of 10 grams(20ml as a solution) of vitamin C with 100ml of normal saline over 30 minutes.
Intravenous injections of 120ml of normal saline over 30 minutes.

intervention.description: Single intravenous injection of vitamin C 10g(20ml) with 100ml of normal saline over 30 minutes
Single intravenous injection of 120ml of normal saline over 30 minutes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Company workers working at least 5 days a week from morning to evening
- Volunteers who provided written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute illness
- Chronic disease such as diabetes, hypertension, liver disease, or renal disease
- Previous history of renal stone or gout
- Pregnant or lactating women
- Hypersensitivity to vitamins or intravenous injections
- History of vitamin supplements orally or parenterally within 2 days
